author: kfogel
msg: * www/project_status.html: Remove projected interim release.
The development heads of apr/apu and httpd have been too unstable the
last few days, so if we released an interim tarball, it would be the
first one that didn't obey the bootstrap rule of "you should update
immediately to head of svn, apr, apu, and httpd to test this".
Doesn't seem worth the effort.  I'd rather spend our time stabilizing
our dependencies and getting Subversion to match them.  If the
instability persists, then we'll have to start recommending dated
revisions of everything.

author: kfogel
msg: Extend the change committed in revision 2586:
* subversion/libsvn_subr/utf.c
(get_ntou_xlate_handle, get_uton_xlate_handle): Test for APR_EINVAL
now that that's what apu returns, and also allow for APR_ENOTIMPL.

author: kfogel
msg: Tweak to revision 2592, so diff_tests.py passes again, plus a couple
of other cleanups.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/svntest/main.py
(run_svn, run_svnadmin): Really use the Win32 approach,
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/utf8_tests.py: Remove semicolons,
save them for another language.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/diff_tests.py
(diff_only_property_change): Use run_svn instead of os.system.  We
were formerly using os.system so we could test the return code
directly; the trouble with that was, it also printed the diff output
to stdout, so when you ran this test by hand, you'd see that output
right there among the PASS/FAIL lines.  Yick.  It should be
sufficient to just use run_svn and check for error output.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/path.c
(svn_path_uri_encode): Cast the character to "unsigned char" for
sprintf() so high-ASCII values aren't destroyed by the "X"
formatting character.

author: sussman
msg: Working on utf8_tests.py...
* utf8_tests.py (basic_utf8_conversion):  commit this half-written
test, so others can start fooling with it.
* svntest/main.py (run_svn):  stop putting each vararg in `backticks`,
as it trashes the i18n string value.  use the win32 approach
instead.
